sentences.en: Bacteria was introduced into his bloodstream through an unsterile needle.
sentences.cn: 细菌通过未消毒的针进入了他的血流中.

sentences.en: But once the infection is over, antibodies remain in the bloodstream to protect against future attack.
sentences.cn: 但是一旦感染过后, 抗体即留在血液中以防备将来再次的袭击.

sentences.en: Certain chemicals are easily absorbed into the bloodstream, while others are not.
sentences.cn: 某些化学药品很容易溶于血液, 有些则不行.

sentences.en: Fungi have a way of turning nasty -- seeping into the bloodstream and invading vital organs.
sentences.cn: 真菌具有转变成十分令人憎恶的方式的能力 —— 渗入血流、侵入重要的器官.

sentences.en: Hormones are secreted into the bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 分泌的激素进入到血液中.

sentences.en: In a way, the Falklands became my life , it even became my bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 从某种角度说, “福克兰岛”成了我的一切, 甚至融化在了我的血液里.

sentences.en: It allows nicotine to diffuse slowly and steadily into the bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 它能使尼古丁平稳缓慢地渗透到血液里。

sentences.en: Kumbhaka is not designed to increase absorption of oxygen into the bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 悬息的主要功能是将增加血液中的含氧量.

sentences.en: My duodenum produces a substance called secretion, which empties into Joe's bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 我的十二指肠生产一种名叫分泌素的物质, 排入乔的血流.

sentences.en: Nutrients are absorbed into the bloodstream.
Once in the bloodstream, the bacteria adhere to the surface of the red cells.
sentences.cn: 细菌一进入血液里，就附着在红细胞表面上。

sentences.en: Red blood cells transport oxygen through the bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 红细胞通过血液循环输送氧气.

sentences.en: Refined sugars are absorbed into the bloodstream very quickly.
sentences.cn: 精制糖迅速吸收进血液中。

sentences.en: The drug is injected directly into the bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 这种药物是直接注射到血液中的。

sentences.en: They injected the drug directly into her bloodstream.
sentences.cn: 他们把药物直接注射到她的血液里。

sentences.en: This medicine can be absorbed into the bloodstream in seconds.
sentences.cn: 这种药在几秒内就可以被血液吸收.

trans.tran_en: the blood flowing in your body
